summary: Silver is a shiny, white metal with the symbol Ag. It has the highest electrical and thermal conductivity of any metal. Found in nature as pure metal or in minerals, it's often produced as a byproduct of refining other metals. Silver has been valuable for centuries, used in coins, jewelry, and utensils. It's also important in technology, like solar panels and water filtration, and in medicine as a disinfectant.
title: Silver
